speaker: George Yin
description: What started as demonstrations against an extradition bill have since taken on a much wider scope. Multiple rumors and speculations sprung at the same time. In the age of post-truth politics, which version of the story should we believe? How should we judge this protest? How should we judge any social movement?

speaker: Richard Eldridge
description: What is Courage? Is it, as was in Harry Potter, a fearless determination to fight evil? If so, how is courage different from goodness, recklessness, or wisdom? By contrasting different theories, Professor Richard Eldridge will offer a clearer view on courage. He will connect courage with Werner Herzogâ€™s films and show how we might act courageously in the modern consumerist society.

speaker: Philip Pettit
description: What is courage? Is it still relevant to us today?
